body_html:
I am sorry, however I cannot reproduce the problem you are seeing.
Here is what I did:

$ git clone git@github.com:tensorflow/tensorflow
$ cd tensorflow
$ nvidia-docker build -f tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu -t tf tensorflow/tools/docker

Outcome:
Successfully built c8163ce55259

Then:
$ nvidia-docker run -it c8163ce55259 bash
$ python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print tf.test.is_gpu_available()"
....
True

Maybe you are not using nvidia docker?
As I cannot reproduce the problem, I am inclined to leave the issue as closed.

body:
I am sorry, however I cannot reproduce the problem you are seeing.
Here is what I did:

$ git clone git@github.com:tensorflow/tensorflow
$ cd tensorflow
$ nvidia-docker build  -f tensorflow/tools/docker/Dockerfile.devel-gpu -t tf tensorflow/tools/docker

Outcome:
Successfully built c8163ce55259

Then:
$ nvidia-docker run -it c8163ce55259 bash
$ python -c "import tensorflow as tf; print tf.test.is_gpu_available()"
....
True

Maybe you are not using nvidia docker?
As I cannot reproduce the problem, I am inclined to leave the issue as closed.
